I don't get it. I move all files to their respective folders and I still can't activate Dawngaurd.

Any help will be appreciated.

5. Locate or search for the SkyrimPrefs.ini file that should be under your My Games subfolder. For example, mine is located at:
C:UsersELOCKLORANMy DocumentsMy GamesSkyrim
6. Open that file and search for [Launcher] and add "bEnableFileSelection=1". It'll look something like this:
[Launcher]
bShowAllResolutions=0
uLastAspectRatio=2
So add that line so it looks like:
[Launcher]
bShowAllResolutions=0
uLastAspectRatio=2
bEnableFileSelection=1
Now the Data Files option will be un-greyed and selectable.

Alright. I solved my problem. The entire time I was trying to install this I was installing this in the wrong installation folder. The previous owner had installed Skyrim and when I uninstalled that game, it didn't remove the default installtion folder. I installed my own copy to a different location (which I just found just now). Now it works. lol. I feel like an idiot. Haha Sorry about that.

well uninstall and delete all folders , install skyrim into C: then copy and paste all files from Skyrim.1x10.Updates.plus.Dawnguard to where you have installed skyrim sample: C:Program Files (x86) The Elder Scrolls V Skyrim re-config prefs.ini file and see if works

Success!

So that nobody spends a buttload of time wandering in circles like I did, here's what you need to do to fix it.

Do not look in your installation folder.  There is a skyrim.prefs in there, and that skyrim.prefs is a terrible, terrible lie.

To find the actual skyrim.prefs you need to edit: 
Open "My Games"
Find the Skyrim folder
Open Skyrim.prefs
Go to the "Launcher" section
Add that bEnableFileSelection=1 line

Thanks a ton for uploading this and telling me how to fix the .prefs problem.
i'm glad you got, enjoy!
